Anthony\'s Quiz App.
You\'ll be asked a series of questions.
Click thumbs up for true, thumbs down for false. Click QUIT to exit and see your score.
Quit
int x[] = new int[]{10,20,30}; Is a valid array constructor in Java
All binary operators except for the assignment operators are evaluated from Left to Right
Constructor overloading is not possible in Java
Java programming is statically-typed,so you must declare variables before using them
Underscore characters \"_\" can appear anywhere between digits in a numerical literal
You must instantiate an interface before using it
The modifiers public and static cannot written in either order \"public static\" or \"static public\"
In the Java programming language we can store many different types of values in a single array
Consider the statement \"x = (a > b) ? a : b\"; then the value of x is 27, if a = 18 and b = 27
If I call \"this.super.toString()\", the this keyword overrides the super keyword and the child object\'s toString() is called
In Java Programming, we must make sure to use nullptr assignment and delete when we are finished with an item created on the heap
In an instance method or constructor, this refers to the current object
Java does not support overloaded constructors
In Java, we can use either \"public static\" or \"static public\"
A .class file contains plain text source code so other programmers can understand how the objects in a program work together
\"$\" and \"_\" may be used at the beginning of a variable name
All Classes in the Java language inherit from java.lang.Class
James Gosling was the inventor of Java
Java is both a language and a platform
